Class JsonRepository

java.lang.Object
musicApp.repositories.JsonRepository
public class JsonRepository extends Object
This class is responsible for reading and writing the settings of the application. The settings are stored in: - Mac: ~/Library/Application Support/musicapp - Windows: %APPDATA%/musicapp - Linux: ~/.config/musicapp

The settings are stored in the following format: balance=0.0 musicFolder=/path/to/music/folder

The default music folder is the user's music folder. If the settings file does not exist, it will be created with the default settings.

    • setPlaylistsPath

      public void setPlaylistsPath(Path newPlaylistsFile)

      Parameters:

    • createFolderIfNotExists

      public void createFolderIfNotExists(Path folder) throws SettingsFilesException
      Creates a folder at the specified path if it does not already exist.

      If the folder already exists, no action is taken. If an error occurs during the folder creation, an error message will be printed to the console.

      Parameters:
      folder - The path of the folder to create.
      Throws:
      SettingsFilesException

    • getFolderByOS

      private Path getFolderByOS(String folderName)
      Returns the folder path based on the operating system.
      Parameters:
      folderName - The name of the folder.
      Returns:
      The folder path.

    • getDefaultMusicFolder

      public Path getDefaultMusicFolder() throws SettingsFilesException
      Returns the default music folder based on the operating system. If the default music folder does not exist, it will be created.
      Returns:
      The default music folder.
      Throws:
      SettingsFilesException

    • writeSettings

      public void writeSettings(Settings settings)
      Writes the settings to the settings file.
      Parameters:
      settings - The settings to write.

    • readSettings

      public Settings readSettings() throws SettingsFilesException
      Reads the settings from the settings file. If the settings file does not exist, it will be created with the default settings.
      Returns:
      The settings read from the settings file.
      Throws:
      SettingsFilesException

    • getSettings

      protected Settings getSettings(Path path) throws SettingsFilesException
      Retrieves the settings from a JSON file located at the specified path.

      The file is parsed into a Settings object using Gson. If an error occurs during the file reading or parsing (e.g., due to invalid JSON syntax, IO issues), an error message is logged, and default settings are returned instead.

      Parameters:
      path - The path to the JSON settings file.
      Returns:
      A Settings object populated with the data from the file, or default settings if an error occurs.
      Throws:
      SettingsFilesException

    • readPlaylists

      public List<Library> readPlaylists() throws IllegalArgumentException
      Reads the playlists from the playlists file. If the playlists file does not exist, it will be created with an empty list of playlists.
      Returns:
      The playlists read from the playlists file.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If an error occurs while reading the playlists file.

    • getPlaylists

      protected List<Library> getPlaylists(Path path) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Reads the playlists from the given path. Mainly kept in protected scope for testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to read the playlists from.
      Returns:
      The playlists read from the given path.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If an error occurs while reading the playlists from the given path.

    • writePlaylists

      public void writePlaylists(List<Library> playlists)
      Writes the playlists to the playlists file.
      Parameters:
      playlists - The playlists to write.

    • checkValidPlaylist

      private void checkValidPlaylist(Library playlist) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Check the validity of a playlist.
      Parameters:
      playlist - The playlist to check.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If the playlist is invalid.

    • checkPlaylists

      private List<Library> checkPlaylists(List<Library> playlists)
      Checks and ensures that a playlist with the name "??favorites??" exists in the provided list of playlists.

      If the list of playlists is null or does not contain a playlist named "??favorites??", a new playlist with this name is added to the beginning of the list. The updated list is then written back to storage.

      Parameters:
      playlists - The list of playlists to check.
      Returns:
      The updated list of playlists, including the "??favorites??" playlist if necessary.

    • readLyricsLibrary

      protected List<LyricsRepository.LyricsFilePaths> readLyricsLibrary(Path lyricsFile)
      Reads the lyrics library from the lyrics file. If the lyrics file does not exist, it will be created with an empty library. protected for testing purposes.
      Returns:
      the list

    • writeLyricsLibrary

      protected void writeLyricsLibrary(Path lyricsFile, List<LyricsRepository.LyricsFilePaths> lib) throws IOException
      Writes the lyrics library to the lyrics file. protected for testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      lib - the lib
      Throws:
      IOException - the io exception

      Throws:

    • getLyricsDir

      public Path getLyricsDir()
      Returns the path to the directory where lyrics are stored.

      The path is constructed by resolving the "lyrics" subdirectory within the settings folder.

      Returns:
      The path to the lyrics directory.
